body_html:
Started a docker container, ran all the same commands as you and got this as a result

[root@216b9202260e /]# python3.6
Python 3.6.4 (default, Jan  5 2018, 02:35:40) 
[GCC 7.2.1 20171224] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
Illegal instruction (core dumped)
[root@216b9202260e /]# echo $?
132

Even inside the docker container I'm receiving the 132 status code.

This was not nvidia docker as I don't have a NVIDIA graphics card (just intel integrated graphics), Not sure if that matters or not though.

Normally I would assume that this is a setup issue with my Python installation. However, the 132 error code (which by definition is for an error caused by RF-Kill) threw me off.

body:
Started a docker container, ran all the same commands as you and got this as a result
```bash
[root@216b9202260e /]# python3.6
Python 3.6.4 (default, Jan  5 2018, 02:35:40) 
[GCC 7.2.1 20171224] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
Illegal instruction (core dumped)
[root@216b9202260e /]# echo $?
132
```

Even inside the docker container I'm receiving the 132 status code.

This was not nvidia docker as I don't have a NVIDIA graphics card (just intel integrated graphics), Not sure if that matters or not though.

Normally I would assume that this is a setup issue with my Python installation. However, the 132 error code (which by definition is for an error caused by RF-Kill) threw me off.
